docs.snippet: Consolidated net income of the Swift International Company, Ltd. in 1948 was 7,015,858 Argentine pesos, equivalent to $1,446,670 in United States currency, the annual report, issued yesterday, disclosed.
docs.lead_paragraph: Consolidated net income of the Swift International Company, Ltd. in 1948 was 7,015,858 Argentine pesos, equivalent to $1,446,670 in United States currency, the annual report, issued yesterday, disclosed.

headline.main: Swift International, Food Packer, Reports Profit in 1948 About Half of '47 Figure

docs.snippet: The General Assembly decided yesterday morning to refer Israel's application for membership in the United Nations to its Political Committee, thus destroying any possibility that Israel could be admitted until the closing weeks of the spring session.
docs.lead_paragraph: The General Assembly decided yesterday morning to refer Israel's application for membership in the United Nations to its Political Committee, thus destroying any possibility that Israel could be admitted until the closing weeks of the spring session.
docs.abstract: UN defers Israeli admission pending decision on plan

headline.main: ASSEMBLY DEFERS ISRAEL'S U.N. HOPES; Application to Join Referred to Political Body, 31-18 -- U. S. on Losing Side ASSEMBLY DEFERS ISRAELI U. N. HOPES

docs.snippet: The United Nations General Assembly sent a new appeal to the Big Five last night to give up a share of their veto power in the Security Council. By a vote of 43 to 6 the Assembly approved a resolution handed in by the United States, Britain, France...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Nations General Assembly sent a new appeal to the Big Five last night to give up a share of their veto power in the Security Council. By a vote of 43 to 6 the Assembly approved a resolution handed in by the United States, Britain, France and China asking for moderation in the use of the veto and advance consultation among the Big Five before major Council decisions.
docs.abstract: Assembly passes 4-power resolution urging voluntary curb

headline.main: U. N. Assembly, 43-6, Urges Voluntary Curb on the Veto; U. N. ASSEMBLY ASKS A CURB ON THE VETO

docs.snippet: The thirteenth annual Three Choir Festival to be sponsored by Temple Emanu-El will be held at the temple on May 6 and 7. The programs will be devoted to "Songs of the Americas, Colonial and New," and the event is being planned as a tribute to the...
docs.lead_paragraph: The thirteenth annual Three Choir Festival to be sponsored by Temple Emanu-El will be held at the temple on May 6 and 7. The programs will be devoted to "Songs of the Americas, Colonial and New," and the event is being planned as a tribute to the American composer.

headline.main: THREE CHOIR FESTIVAL TO HONOR COMPOSERS

docs.snippet: Pound sterling was hit hard again last week, the spot rate slipping to $4.02 3/4, the support point, previously touched about ten days ago for a new low, while the discount on forwards widened to approximately 8 cents on 90-day contracts, and to 12...
docs.lead_paragraph: Pound sterling was hit hard again last week, the spot rate slipping to $4.02 3/4, the support point, previously touched about ten days ago for a new low, while the discount on forwards widened to approximately 8 cents on 90-day contracts, and to 12 cents on six months', new minimums since February, 1948.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended April 15, 1949.

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, April 18 -Cuba proposed today the creation of a special fifteen-member United Nations committee to conduct on-the-spot investigations whether human rights and fundamental freedoms had been violated in a series of prosecutions of...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, April 18 -Cuba proposed today the creation of a special fifteen-member United Nations committee to conduct on-the-spot investigations whether human rights and fundamental freedoms had been violated in a series of prosecutions of religious leaders by the Communist Governments of Hungary, Bulgaria and Yugoslavia.
docs.abstract: Cuba proposes 15-member UN com make on-the-spot probe of Prot mins' trial, Ad Hoc Pol Com; resolution text

headline.main: On-Spot Study of Clerics' Trials By U. N. Group Proposed by Cuba; CUBA URGES U. N. TO STUDY TRIALS

byline.original: By W. H. LAWRENCESpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, April 19 -- Divisions over the allocation of the former Italian colonies in Africa were accentuated by today's debate in the Political and Security Committee of the United Nations General Assembly, and representatives of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, April 19 -- Divisions over the allocation of the former Italian colonies in Africa were accentuated by today's debate in the Political and Security Committee of the United Nations General Assembly, and representatives of the Latin-American and Arab-Asiatic blocs will confer tomorrow in an effort to reach a compromise settlement.
docs.abstract: Egypt in UN backs US plan

headline.main: ITALIAN ISSUE TIED TO OTHERS IN U. N.; Compromise Talks May Involve Accord on Indonesia and Admission of Israel

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: LAKE SUCCESS, April 24 -- The International Labor Organization called upon the economically underdeveloped nations of Latin America today to take stock of their resources and manpower and then plan collectively to gain the fullest benefit from...
docs.lead_paragraph: LAKE SUCCESS, April 24 -- The International Labor Organization called upon the economically underdeveloped nations of Latin America today to take stock of their resources and manpower and then plan collectively to gain the fullest benefit from President Truman's "bold new program."

headline.main: ILO ASKS AMERICAS FOR AID PROGRAMS; On Eve of Montevideo Meeting Report Here Stresses Value of Truman's Plan

byline.original: By KATHLEEN TELTSCHSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES
